Row.Text: This information is only available if you have an Embassy with this Civilization

Replace.Text: [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]The empire is in [ICON_RESISTANCE] Anarchy for {1_Turns} more turn(s). During Anarchy, the empire will not gain any [ICON_RESEARCH] Science, [ICON_GOLD] Gold, [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, or [ICON_PEACE] Faith, and cities have no [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production to build anything. You also may not change your State Religion.[ENDCOLOR]

Row.Text: You may spend [ICON_JFD_PIETY] Piety to improve your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence with this City-State, so long as they follow {1_ReligionIcon} {2_ReligionDesc} as their State Religion.

Over time, the amount of [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence earned from gifts of [ICON_JFD_PIETY] Piety goes down. Additionally, the more [ICON_JFD_PIETY] Piety you give in a single gift, the more [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence is earned - making larger gifts is more efficient!
{1_Num} [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence is needed to be Friends, and {2_Num} is needed to be Allies. You currently have {3_Num} [ICON_INFLUENCE].
Are you sure you want to spend {1_Num} [ICON_JFD_PIETY] Piety for {2_Num} [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence?

Replace.Text: {1_ReligionName} has become your new majority Religion. This shift in religious status may affect your relationship with other Civilizations, as well as your own population.

{1_ReligionName} is now your primary Religion. You alone will benefit from [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Founder[ENDCOLOR] and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Reformation[ENDCOLOR] Beliefs related to {1_ReligionName}, and any Founder or Reformation Beliefs related to prior Religions are no longer valid.

The Holy City of {1_CityName:textkey} was captured by {@2_CivName}! If {@2_CivName} is eliigble, {3_Religion} may become their primary Religion, thus giving them access to its Founder and Reformation Bonuses. If {3_Religion} was your primary Religion, you lose access to its Beliefs until you retake it.

You captured the Holy City of {1_CityName:textkey}! If eligible, {2_Religion} may become your primary Relgion, thus giving you access to the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Founder[ENDCOLOR] and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Reformation[ENDCOLOR] Belief bonuses associated with it (so long as you retain control of the City).

Row.Text: You may adopt a State Religion![NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Go to the Religion Overview to do so.
You may Secularize your State Religion![NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Go to the Religion Overview to do so.

Replace.Text: You have founded the new religion [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{@1_ReligionName}[ENDCOLOR] in the holy city of {@2_CityName}.
{1_CivName} {1: plural 1?has; 2?have;} founded the new religion [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{@2_ReligionName}[ENDCOLOR] in the holy city of {@3_CityName}.
An unknown civilization has founded the new religion [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{@1_ReligionName}[ENDCOLOR] in one of their cities.

Row.Text: You have adopted [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_Religion}[ENDCOLOR] as your State Religion.
{1_CivName} has adopted [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_Religion}[ENDCOLOR] as their State Religion.
You have adopted [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_Religion}[ENDCOLOR] as your new State Religion, replacing [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]{2_Religion}[ENDCOLOR].
{1_CivName} has adopted [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_Religion}[ENDCOLOR] as their new State Religion, replacing [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]{3_Religion}[ENDCOLOR].
[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT][ICON_RESISTANCE] Resistance has broken out over your recent change in State Religion![ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT][ICON_RESISTANCE] Resistance has broken out over your recent Secularization![ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT][ICON_PEACE] Faith has been lost over your recent change in State Religion![ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT][ICON_PEACE] Faith has been lost over your recent Secularization![ENDCOLOR]

Your [ICON_JFD_PIETY] Piety is now considered {1_PietyColour}{2_PietyLevel}[ENDCOLOR].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Left-click to bring up the Religion Overview, to see how your Piety is generated.[ENDCOLOR]

Your State Religion is [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_ReligionIcon} {2_ReligionDesc}[ENDCOLOR].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Your main source of [ICON_JFD_PIETY] Piety is gained from [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{3_FollowerDesc}[ENDCOLOR]:[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{4_FollowerHelp}

Your Piety Level is considered {1_PietyColor}{2_PietyLevel}[ENDCOLOR].[NEWLINE]Piety Level changes at: {1_PietyColor}{8_Num}[ENDCOLOR] ({3_HL}{4_Num}[ENDCOLOR] Turns).[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]You maintain {1_PietyColor}{5_Num}[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_JFD_PIETY] Piety in total ({3_HL}{6_Num}[ENDCOLOR] Per Turn).{7_Source}

You maintain {1_PietyColor}{5_Num}[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_JFD_PIETY] Piety in total.[NEWLINE]Your [ICON_JFD_PIETY] Piety is considered {3_HL}{2_PietyLevel}[ENDCOLOR].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Piety Level changes: [COLOR_JFD_PIETY]{4_Num} TURNS[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_JFD_PIETY]{6_Num}[ENDCOLOR] Piety [ICON_JFD_PIETY] Per Turn[NEWLINE]{7_Source}
[ICON_JFD_PIETY] Piety Rate will be re-calculated at the beginning of each turn.
[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]{1_Num}[ENDCOLOR] from Cities not following your State Religion.
[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]{1_Num}[ENDCOLOR] from Cities not following your State Religion of Civilizations that are.
[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]{1_Num}[ENDCOLOR] from war with Civilizations following your State Religion.
[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]{1_Num}[ENDCOLOR] from Civilizations following your State Religion.
[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]{1_Num}[ENDCOLOR] from City-States following your State Religion.
[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]{1_Num}[ENDCOLOR] from being above your Resting Rate.
[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]-{1_Num}[ENDCOLOR] from Civilizations with your State Religion (when above Resting Rate).
[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]-{1_Num}[ENDCOLOR] from City-States with your State Religion (when above Resting Rate).
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+{1_Num}[ENDCOLOR] from being below your Resting Rate.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+{1_Num}[ENDCOLOR] from Civilizations with your State Religion (when below Resting Rate).
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+{1_Num}[ENDCOLOR] from City-States with your State Religion (when below Resting Rate).

In addition to from certain Beliefs, Decisions, Events, Policies, and Wonders, you earn Piety whenever a Civilization or City-State adopts your State Religion. If for the first time, the amount is greater.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+{1_Num}[ENDCOLOR] from holding the Holy City for your State Religion.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+{1_Num}[ENDCOLOR] from other Holy City Owners following your State Religion.
You earn [ICON_JFD_PIETY] Piety at [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_Num}%[ENDCOLOR] from all sources.{2_YieldSources}
This religion is your civilization's preference.
You must have researched Priesthood to adopt a State Religion. There must be a valid Religion and you must have met the founder.

You must have researched Priesthood to [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]adopt[ENDCOLOR] a State Religion. There must be a valid Religion and you must have met the founder.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]You may [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]secularize[ENDCOLOR] your State Religion once you have researched Scientific Theory.

You must have researched Priesthood to [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]adopt[ENDCOLOR] a State Religion. There must be a valid Religion and you must have met the founder.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]You may [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]secularize[ENDCOLOR] your State Religion once you have researched Liberalism.
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]You are a Theocracy and cannot do this.[ENDCOLOR]
Choose a religion from the list above
Your civilization will become a Secular nation, disabling your State Religion and [ICON_JFD_PIETY] Piety.

Your civilization will become a Secular nation, disabling your State Religion and [ICON_JFD_PIETY] Piety.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Secular[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Eliminates [ICON_JFD_CRIME_BLACK] Crime from [ICON_JFD_CRIME_WHITE] Heresy.
Your civilization will become a Secular nation.

Your civilization will become a Secular nation.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]This will incur {1_Num} turn(s) of [ICON_RESISTANCE] Resistance in all cities following your current State Religion.[ENDCOLOR]
Your civilization will become a Secular nation.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]This will cost {1_Num} [ICON_PEACE] Faith.[ENDCOLOR]
Are you sure you want to Secularize? [COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]This action cannot be undone.[ENDCOLOR]

Are you sure you want to Secularize? [COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]This action cannot be undone and will incur {1_Num} turn(s) of [ICON_RESISTANCE] Resistance in all cities following your current State Religion.[ENDCOLOR]
Are you sure you want to Secularize? [COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]This action cannot be undone and will cost {1_Num} [ICON_PEACE] Faith.[ENDCOLOR]
{1_ReligionDesc} will be established as your State Religion.
{1_ReligionDesc} will be declared your new State Religion.

{1_ReligionDesc} will be declared your new State Religion.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]This will incur {2_Num} turn(s) of [ICON_RESISTANCE] Resistance in all cities following your current State Religion.[ENDCOLOR]
{1_ReligionDesc} will be declared your new State Religion.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]This will cost {2_Num} [ICON_PEACE] Faith.[ENDCOLOR]
Are you sure you want to adopt {1_ReligionDesc} as your State Religion?

Are you sure you want to adopt {1_ReligionDesc} as your State Religion? [COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]This will incur {2_Num} turn(s) of [ICON_RESISTANCE] Resistance in all cities following your current State Religion.[ENDCOLOR]
Are you sure you want to adopt {1_ReligionDesc} as your State Religion? [COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]This will cost {2_Num} [ICON_PEACE] Faith.[ENDCOLOR]
You have not met any civilizations with a State Religion.

They have a {1_Num}% chance to adopt [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_Religion}[ENDCOLOR] as their State Religion.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]You can increase this chance by improving your relationship with them. This chance also peaks in the Medieval and Renaissance Eras.
They cannot adopt a State Religion.
They have no desire to adopt a State Religion.
They have no desire to change their State Religion.
They have no desire to secularize.
They have a {1_Num}% chance to secularize.
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have founded {1_ReligionDesc} and their Capital follows it.[ENDCOLOR]
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]As a Theocracy, they will not relinquish their State Religion.[ENDCOLOR]
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have not met the conditions to establish a State Religion.[ENDCOLOR]
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have not met the conditions to Secularize.[ENDCOLOR]
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have no interest in having a State Religion.[ENDCOLOR]
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They changed their State Religion recently. They will reconsider in {1_Num} Turn(s).[ENDCOLOR]
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They changed their State Religion recently. They will consider Secularizing in {1_Num} Turn(s).[ENDCOLOR]
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They do not have a religion in the majority of their cities or in their Capital.[ENDCOLOR]
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]They are too committed to their State Religion.[ENDCOLOR]
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]As a Religious City-State, they will never Secularize.[ENDCOLOR]
Need a State Religion in order to have [ICON_JFD_PIETY] Piety. Go to the Decisions Panel to establish a State Religion
Need a State Religion in order to have [ICON_JFD_PIETY] Piety. But you have secularized. Sorry.
[COLOR_JFD_PIETY]+{1_Num} [ICON_JFD_PIETY][ENDCOLOR] from capturing a city with followers of [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_ReligionName}[ENDCOLOR] under the control of a heathen!
[COLOR_JFD_PIETY]-{1_Num} [ICON_JFD_PIETY][ENDCOLOR] from losing a city with followers of [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]{2_ReligionName}[ENDCOLOR] to a heathen!
